info.name: LMS CMApi
info.description:
**Title:** LMS Course Management API  

### **Description:**

This API allows developers to manage all resources in the **Learning Management System (LMS)** — including Teachers, Students, Courses, Assignments, and more.  
  
It follows RESTful principles and supports JSON requests/responses. Developers authenticate using **API keys**, and users (teachers, students, or admins) authenticate using **JWT tokens**.

The system is designed for multi-developer isolation:  
  
each developer’s API key identifies their own data environment.

**Base URL:**

`{{base_url}}`

Use this collection to exercise

**Headers you’ll usually need**

```
api_key: {{workspace_api_key}}        # tenant/workspace
Authorization: Bearer {{jwt}}           # actor (teacher/student/admin)
Content-Type: application/json

 ```

**Typical flow**

1. **Admin Setup**
    
    1. Create an admin/developer account
        
    2. Generate an **API key** for the developer
        
    3. (Optional) Seed demo data for testing with `POST /api/dev/seed/`
        
2. **User Management**
    
    1. Register new users (teachers, students, or guests) under that developer
        
    2. Login to obtain a JWT token
        
    3. Use the JWT + API key to make requests to other endpoints
        
3. **LMS Operations**
    
    1. Manage teachers, students, lessons, courses, assignments, and progress
        
    2. CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) available for each resourceEndFragment  
        

## Environment Variables

| Variable | Purpose |
| --- | --- |
| `{{base_url}}` | Your local or production API root |
| `{{developer_api_key}}` | The active developer API key |
| `{{jwt}}` | The user’s JSON Web Token (after login) |

## Common Errors

| Code | Meaning | Example Cause |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 400 | Bad Request | Invalid payload or missing fields |
| 401 | Unauthorized | Missing/invalid JWT or API key |
| 403 | Forbidden | User not allowed or invalid developer key |
| 404 | Not Found | Object doesn’t exist in this developer’s data |
| 409 | Conflict | Duplicate entry (e.g., same email or title) |

### **Folder Overview**

- **Admin:** Endpoints for managing developer accounts, API keys, and seeding demo data.
    
- **Account:** Endpoints for user registration and authentication (JWT management).
    
- **Teachers:** Endpoints for managing teacher profiles and related operations.

request.description: Creates a new **developer (admin)** account. Each account will be able to generate API keys and manage its own user environment.
Authenticates an admin user and returns a **JWT token** for secure access to protected endpoints.
Refreshes the expired **JWT access token** using the refresh token.
Generates a new **API key** for the developer’s account. This key is required for authorized API access.
Retrieves the list of all **active API keys** belonging to the logged-in developer.
Seeds a new **default workspace** environment with base configurations (e.g., default roles, permissions, or test users).
Retrieves all registered users under the admin’s developer account.
Allows an admin to **update a user’s role** (e.g., student → teacher).
Deletes a previously generated **API key**, revoking its access immediately.

item.name: Account

request.description: Creates a new user under your developer account.
Authenticates a user and returns JWT access and refresh tokens.
Exchanges a valid refresh token for a new access token.

item.description:
The **Account** folder handles user registration and authentication within the developer’s environment.  
  
It provides endpoints to:

- Register users (teachers, students, or guests)
    
- Authenticate users via login
    
- Refresh expired JWT access tokens
    

Each request requires a valid **API key** that identifies the developer account.  
  
Authentication uses **JWT** tokens to protect endpoints and user sessions.

**Base URL:** `{{base_url}}`

**Headers you’ll often need:**

| Key | Value |
| --- | --- |
| `api_key` | `{{developer_api_key}}` |
| `Authorization` | `Bearer {{jwt}}` _(optional except for refresh)_ |
| `Content-Type` | `application/json` |

**Typical Flow:**

1. Register a user (under your developer account).
    
2. Login to get JWT access and refresh tokens.
    
3. Use the access token to call protected routes (e.g., Teachers, Students, courses).
    
4. Refresh the access token when expired.

item.description:
CRUD for teacher profiles within the current developer environment .

**Common operations**

- **GET /teachers/** – list teachers for this environment(Admin only).
    
- **GET /teachers/:id/** – details.
    
- **PATCH /teachers/:id/** – update profile fields.
    
- **DELETE /teachers/:id/** – remove.
    

**Model (key fields)**

```
{
  "id": 1,
  "user": { "id": 10, "username": "ws__teacher1", "email": "..." },
  "specialization": "Math",
  "experience": 5,
  "is_active": true,
  "created_at": "...",
  "updated_at": "..."
}

 ```

**Rules**

- All results are **auto-scoped** to `request.develoepr`.
    
- Use `Authorization: Bearer {{jwt}}` from a teacher/admin account.

item.name: Students
item.description:
Manage student profiles within the current workspace.

**Common operations**

- **GET /students/** – list (Admin/Teacher).
    
- **GET /students/:id/** – details.
    
- **PATCH /students/:id/** – update info.
    
- **DELETE /students/:id/** – remove.
    

**Model (key fields)**

```
{
  "id": 1,
  "user": { "id": 21, "username": "ws__student1", "email": "..." },
  "age": 22,
  "enrolled_date": "2025-09-20",
  "is_active": true
}

 ```

**Rules**

- Always tenant-scoped by `X-API-Key`.
    
- Students may only see/update their own profile (depending on perms).

item.name: Courses

body.raw:
{
  "title": "Intro to Drilling 2",

  "level": "intermediate"
}

item.description:
Create and manage courses; enroll students; set instructors.

**Common operations**

- **GET /courses/** – list courses (teacher sees own; student sees enrolled).
    
- **POST /courses/** – create course.
    
- **GET /courses/:id/** – details.
    
- **PATCH /courses/:id/** – update.
    
- **DELETE /courses/:id/** – remove.
    

**Create payload (teacher)**

``` json
{
  "title": "Intro to Python",
  "description": "Basics",
  "start_date": "2025-10-01",
  "end_date": "2025-12-01",
  "duration": 60,
  "category": "Programming",
  "level": "beginner",
  "students": [/* optional student IDs in same workspace */]
}

 ```

**Rules**

- **Teachers cannot set** **`instructor`** in the payload; it’s auto-set to the caller’s teacher profile.
    
- **Admins** may set `instructor`, but it **must** be in the same workspace.
    
- All related objects (students/instructor) are validated to belong to the tenant.

item.name: course-materials

formdata.value: Lecture slides and notes for Week 1.

item.description:
Upload/download course files (per workspace).

**Common operations**

- **GET /course-materials/** – list materials.
    
- **POST /course-materials/** – create (multipart).
    
- **GET /course-materials/:id/** – details (and file URL).
    
- **DELETE /course-materials/:id/** – remove.
    

**Create (multipart)**

- Headers: `Content-Type: multipart/form-data`
    
- Body (form-data):
    
    - `course`: (must be in tenant)
        
    - `title`: `Syllabus`
        
    - `file`: _(choose file)_
        

**Notes**

- Files are stored under `/media/...` in dev; use object storage in prod.

item.name: lessons
item.description:
Manage lessons within a course.

**Common operations**

- **GET /lessons/** – list lessons for tenant.
    
- { "course": 12, "title": "Lesson 1", "content": "Intro...", "order": 1 }
    
- **GET /lessons/:id/** – details.
    
- **PATCH /lessons/:id/** – update.
    
- **DELETE /lessons/:id/** – remove.
    

**Rules**

- `course` must belong to the same workspace.

item.name: assignments
item.description:
Create assignments per course; students will submit against them.

**Common operations**

- **GET /assignments/** – list by tenant (teacher sees own courses; students see enrolled courses).
    
- **POST /assignments/** – create:
    
    - `{ "course": 12, "title": "Assignment 1", "description": "Do things", "due_date": "2025-10-20T23:59:59Z"}`
        
- **GET /assignments/:id/**, **PATCH**, **DELETE**.
    

**Rules**

- `course` must be in tenant; teacher typically must own the course.

item.name: submissions
item.description:
Students upload work; teachers/admins can grade.

**Common operations**

- **GET /submissions/** – student sees own; teacher sees for their courses.
    
- **POST /submissions/** – **student** creates (multipart):
    
    - form-data:
        
        - `assignment`: (in tenant)
            
        - `file`: _(choose file)_
            
- **PATCH /submissions/:id/** – **teacher/admin** can set `grade`.
    
    - { "grade": 92.5 }
        
- **DELETE /submissions/:id/** – remove (policy-dependent).
    

**Rules**

- Student can only submit **their own** work.
    
- Optional enforcement: edits blocked after `due_date`.
    
- Files live under `/media/submissions/` in dev.

item.name: progress
item.description:
Track which lessons each student has completed.

**Common operations**

- **GET /progress/** – list progress rows for tenant (student sees own; teacher sees for their courses).
    
- **POST /progress/** – create/toggle:
    
    - `{ "student": 31, "lesson": 44, "completed": true }`
        
- **PATCH /progress/:id/** – update completion status.
    

**Rules**

- Unique per `(student, lesson)`; all entities must belong to tenant.
